object.name: Device.Cellular.
object.description: This object models cellular interfaces and access points.

parameter.name: RoamingEnabled
parameter.description: Enables or disables roaming.

parameter.name: RoamingStatus
parameter.description: Current roaming status.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: AccessPointNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.Cellular.Interface.{i}.
object.description: Cellular interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). Each instance of this object models a cellular modem with a single radio and a single {{object|USIM}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description:
Enables or disables the interface.
This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description:
The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}}
When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface).
When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}}
* SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic.
* SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed)
* SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface
* SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason.
Because the interface includes layer 1 the {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} value SHOULD never be used.
This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description:
{{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.
Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description:
Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}).
For example:
* For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces.
* For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface.
* For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces.

parameter.name: IMEI
parameter.description: International Mobile Station Equipment Identity number, represented as a 15 digit string (digits 0-9).

parameter.name: SupportedAccessTechnologies
parameter.description: Access technologies supported by the interface.

enumeration.description: UMTS with High Speed Packet Access (HSPA {{bibref|3GPP-HSPA}})

parameter.name: PreferredAccessTechnology
parameter.description: Preferred access technology.

parameter.name: CurrentAccessTechnology
parameter.description: Access technology that is currently in use.

parameter.name: AvailableNetworks
parameter.description: List of available networks.

parameter.name: NetworkRequested
parameter.description: Name of the network which will be used, or {{empty}} if the network is selected automatically.

parameter.name: NetworkInUse
parameter.description: The value is {{empty}} if no network is found, or if the network specified in {{param|NetworkRequested}} is not found.

parameter.name: RSSI
RSRP
RSRQ
UpstreamMaxBitRate
parameter.description: The current maximum attainable data rate upstream (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: DownstreamMaxBitRate
parameter.description: The current maximum attainable data rate downstream (expressed in {{units}}).

object.name: Device.Cellular.Interface.{i}.USIM.
object.description: USIM (Universal Subscriber Identity Module or SIM card) parameters for the interface.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current status of the USIM card.

enumeration.description: Card is available but not verified
Card can be used; either valid PIN was entered, or PIN check is deactivated
USIM is blocked because the maximum number of invalid PIN entries was exceeded
An error was detected with the card

parameter.name: IMSI
parameter.description: International Mobile Subscriber Identity represented as a string with either 14 or 15 digits (digits 0-9). The first 3 digits are the mobile country code (MCC), which are followed by the mobile network code (MNC), either 2 digits (European standard) or 3 digits (North American standard), followed by the mobile subscription identification number (MSIN).

parameter.name: ICCID
parameter.description:
Integrated Circuit Card Identifier represented as a string of up to 20 digits (digits 0-9). The number is composed of the following parts:
* Major industry identifier (MII), 2 fixed digits, 89 for telecommunication purposes.
* Country code, 1–3 digits, as defined by ITU-T recommendation {{bibref|ITU-E.164}}.
* identifier, 1–4 digits.
* Individual account identification number. Its length is variable, but every number under one IIN will have the same length.
* Single check digit calculated from the other digits using the Luhn algorithm.
For cards using an ICCID according to {{bibref|ITU-E.118}} the maximum length is 19 Digits, for GSM cards 20 digits.

parameter.name: MSISDN
PINCheck
parameter.description: Controls the PIN verification of the USIM card.

enumeration.description: Check the PIN with each access to a new network
Check the PIN with first access after (re)boot

parameter.name: PIN
parameter.description: Allows the Controller to change the USIM PIN used for SIM card activation.

object.name: Device.Cellular.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description:
Throughput statistics for this interface.
The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

object.name: Device.Cellular.AccessPoint.{i}.
object.description: Cellular Access Point table. Each entry is identified by an {{param|APN}} (Access Point Name) that identifies a gateway between the mobile network and another computer network.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the Access Point.

parameter.name: APN
parameter.description: Access Point Name.

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username used to authenticate the CPE when making a connection to the Access Point.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password used to authenticate the CPE when making a connection to the Access Point.

parameter.name: Proxy
parameter.description: Proxy server IP address.

parameter.name: ProxyPort
parameter.description: Proxy server port.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: Reference to the interface with which the access point is associated.
